quotes.quote: The reason there is so little crime in Germany is that it's against the law.
quotes.author: Alex Levin

quotes.quote: Crime does not pay ... as well as politics.
quotes.author: Alfred E. Newman

quotes.quote: Life is nothing but a competition to be the criminal rather than the victim.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: When you think of the long and gloomy history of man, you will find more hideous crimes have been committed in the name of obedience than have ever been committed in the name of rebellion.
quotes.author: C. P. Snow

quotes.quote: Crooks are early adopters.
quotes.author: Craig Newmark

quotes.quote: History is indeed little more than the register of the crimes, follies and misfortunes of mankind.
quotes.author: Edward Gibbon

quotes.quote: Crime is naught but misdirected energy.
quotes.author: Emma Goldman

quotes.quote: Obviously crime pays, or there'd be no crime.
quotes.author: G. Gordon Liddy

quotes.quote: Criminals do not die by the hands of the law. They die by the hands of other men.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Behind every great fortune there is a crime.
quotes.author: Honore de Balzac

quotes.quote: Criminal: A person with predatory instincts who has not sufficient capital to form a corporation.
quotes.author: Howard Scott

quotes.quote: Going to trial with a lawyer who considers your whole life-style a Crime in Progress is not a happy prospect.
quotes.author: Hunter S. Thompson

quotes.quote: A crime which is the crime of many none avenge.
quotes.author: Lucan

quotes.quote: We have a criminal jury system which is superior to any in the world; and its efficiency is only marred by the difficulty of finding twelve men every day who don't know anything and can't read.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: The most dangerous criminal may be the man gifted with reason, but with no morals.
quotes.author: Maximilien Robespierre

quotes.quote: Crime butchers innocence to secure a throne, and innocence struggles with all its might against the attempts of crime.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: The judge is condemned when the criminal is absolved.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: There is no den in the wide world to hide a rogue. Commit a crime and the earth is made of glass. Commit a crime, and it seems as if a coat of snow fell on the ground, such as reveals in the woods the track of every partridge, and fox, and squirrel.
quotes.author: Randy K. Milholland

quotes.quote: The key is to commit crimes so confusing that police feel too stupid to even write a crime report about them.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: Indeed, history is nothing more than a tableau of crimes and misfortunes.
quotes.author: W. H. Auden

quotes.quote: Murder is unique in that it abolishes the party it injures, so that society has to take the place of the victim and on his behalf demand atonement or grant forgiveness; it is the one crime in which society has a direct interest.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.quote: Organized crime in America takes in over forty billion dollars a year and spends very little on office supplies.
